data.text:
2025 was a wild year in B2B tech sales. 

Your company either led the charge or followed the herd.

There was no inbetween.

Especially pertaining to AI.

Your revenue leader either took risks and innovated.

Or they sat quietly waiting for the answers. 

SDRs and AEs either felt empowered or overwhelmed.

We want to celebrate the best revenue AI innovators of 2025.

The people who actually moved the needle forward.

If someone comes to mind, please nominate them for...

The Momentum.io 2025 GTM AI Awards: https://lnkd.in/e7Ptj7nM

Please like and share so we can reach as many people as possible.

Feel free to also tag your nominations!

Recognition is the best holiday gift.

Thank you üòÅ

author.headline: Brand partnership ‚Ä¢ 5x Sales Leader / 2 Exits / VP Sales / CRO / Consultant / Advisor / Coach / collincadmus.com

data.text:
I spent two days at SaaStr.ai London learning how operators are bringing AI into their organisations. A few things became clear.

AI native companies are moving faster because they treat agents as part of the way the organisation runs. They build them into real workflows, they train them, they correct them and they expect them to help people be productive. They also measure how those agents behave from the start, not to force early ROI, but to understand whether the system is learning and where it needs attention.

I also saw how teams are starting to use customer conversation data as a real asset. Calls, emails and tickets are being turned into a structured view of what is happening across accounts. Momentum.io and Contentful gave a strong keynote on this, showing how structured interaction data can change coaching, forecasting and customer progression. 

Everyone has enthusiasm for AI. What separates the teams that are gaining ground is their level of commitment to a strategy and a shared framework. They understand the sequence: strategy, implementation, adoption and then ROI. 

My takeaway is that organisations have spent twenty years blaming failed technology shifts on people and process. If we don‚Äôt get the organisational side right for AI, the same thing will happen again. You could be late to the cloud wave and still survive. Being late to the AI wave may not be as forgiving.

data.text:
Most GTM teams think they‚Äôre ‚Äúusing AI.‚Äù

But let‚Äôs be honest‚Ä¶ most are just prompting ChatGPT and calling it a strategy.

That‚Äôs why this book stands out:

Ignite Your GTM with AI by Momentum.io  finally shows what real AI looks like inside a revenue org - with each chapter written by a different GTM leader who‚Äôs actually in the trenches today.

People like:
Christina Brady on AI in coaching
Kyle Norton on the transformation from people manager to systems engineer
Brendan Short on the constant debate between Build vs Buy
Mark Turner on AI-powered deal management
 ‚Ä¶and a ton more.

Here are the 3 things that hit me immediately:

1. It‚Äôs practical, not poetic.
Real workflows. Real examples. Actual operators showing what they do, not theorizing what AI might do someday.

2. The frameworks are insanely useful.
Context Engineering
Human-AI Orchestration
Signals Mapping
These are ‚ÄúI could implement this tomorrow‚Äù kind of frameworks.

3. It covers the entire customer journey.
Not just top-of-funnel.
Not just automation.
A true end-to-end GTM architecture.

If you want clarity more clarity and less chaos in how to bring AI into your revenue org‚Ä¶ this is your book!

data.text:
Kyle Poyar and I asked our communities which are the must-try tools for 2025.
üèÜ Here are the 22 winners that made it to the list üëá

1. Clay
2. Lovable
3. n8n
4. Instantly.ai
5. ChatGPT
6. Sora
7. Replit
8. Apollo
9. HeyReach.io
10. Keyplay
11. UserGems üíé
12. Tofu
13. Gong
14. Momentum.io
15. Vector üëª
16. Relay.app
17. Unify
18. Fluint
19. Profound
20. HockeyStack
21. Magic Patterns
22. Dust

With Clay, Lovable, and n8n leading the way in GTM engineering, vibe-driven marketing, and agentic workflows, it‚Äôs clear the modern GTM stack is evolving fast.

I was happy to see some AI-native GTM tools make the list.

And a bit shocked to see message senders still among the must-try picks üòÖ.

Then again, many teams are still building their outbound motion as they should ‚Ä¶ 

Why? 

Signal-based outbound was often mentioned as one of the most promising GTM channels for 2026, right next to AEO (Answer Engine Optimization).

Here is my deep dive into these findings: https://lnkd.in/dzUwDd6U 


What tools are you excited to see on this list?
And what‚Äôs absolutely missing?

Pitch in comments and let‚Äôs build the perfect GTM stack for 2026.

author.headline: Co-founder/COO @ Momentum - AI GTM Data Orchestration

data.text:
üöÄ Featured in The AI Journal

Momentum.io CEO, Santiago Suarez Ordo√±ez, explored what most AI tools are still missing, and why the next wave of adoption won‚Äôt come from copilots, but from Agentic AI.

Here‚Äôs the truth:
Most revenue teams today don‚Äôt lack visibility, they lack execution.

We‚Äôve overloaded reps with dashboards, summaries, and transcripts...
But none of those tools actually take action.

And the result?
‚Ä¢ 83% of customer data never makes it into systems
‚Ä¢ 45% of insights never reach the teams that could act on them
‚Ä¢ Up to 25% of annual revenue gets lost in the execution gap

This isn‚Äôt a tech stack problem.

It‚Äôs an operating system problem.

Agentic AI flips the model:
‚Ä¢ Captures and acts on insights in real time
‚Ä¢ Updates the CRM
‚Ä¢ Routes risk signals
‚Ä¢ Alerts AEs and loops in CSMs

All automatically. Right inside the tools your team already uses.

According to Deloitte, 25% of companies will pilot agentic systems this year.

Because leaders are done with passive AI that surfaces more work instead of less.

The shift has already begun.

If your GTM still runs on summaries and slides‚Ä¶
It‚Äôs time to build the infrastructure that actually moves the needle.

Full article in the comments belowüëá

At #Dreamforce Next Week? You're invited!

Join us for an exclusive revenue leaders dinner to Ignite your GTM with AI.

In this intimate setting, you'll gain actionable insights on GTM and AI strategies, exchange ideas and best practices with industry peers, and connect with leaders who are reimagining how revenue teams operate and scale.

Seating is limited, register in the comments below!

Location and restaurant details will be shared upon registration.

Next week, San Francisco will be a convergence of ideas, people, and possibilities. Tech Week and Dreamforce happening back to back is a rare chance for the GTM community to step out of day-to-day execution and imagine what comes next.

Join us:

author.headline: Co-Founder, CEO at Momentum | Enterprise Listening + Automation

data.text: We're #hiring a new Senior Platform Engineer in Vancouver, British Columbia. Apply today or share this post with your network.

Momentum isn‚Äôt another conversation intelligence tool. It‚Äôs infrastructure.

CI was game-changing when it launched. It gave revenue teams the ability to capture and store calls, search for what mattered, and share clips.

But it still left one major gap: the human had to do the work.

As our CEO Santiago Suarez Ordo√±ez explains in this video, we didn‚Äôt build Momentum to be another platform that reps occasionally log into. We built it as a real-time pipeline that integrates into your tech stack and works automatically.

CI gives you the archive. Momentum gives you the infrastructure.

Here‚Äôs what that means in practice:
‚Ä¢ CI tools: You log in, watch hours of recordings, take notes, and manually update CRM.
‚Ä¢ Momentum: Every call is analyzed, the 80 words that matter are extracted from 8,000, CRM is instantly updated, managers are notified, and clips are delivered to the right people.

No extra tabs. No ‚ÄúI‚Äôll update Salesforce later.‚Äù No adoption problem.

The breakthrough: tools make you come to them, but infrastructure comes to you.

Momentum layers on top of your existing CI stack or runs end-to-end on its own. Your reps don‚Äôt change behavior. They just gain superpowers.

One captures conversations. The other orchestrates revenue.

Momentum.io is redefining revenue orchestration with SmartClips & Account Briefs.

From instant, shareable sales insights to AI-driven account intelligence, these tools cut hours of manual work, boost deal execution, and keep teams ahead.

‚ÄúWith the addition of SmartClips, it is like combining OpusClip with TikTok but for sales, customer success, and GTM teams,‚Äù said Jonathan M K., head of GTM growth at Momentum.

The future of GTM efficiency is here.

Read more: https://lnkd.in/gnQD_xC2

#AI #RevenueOrchestration #SalesTech #SmartClips #AccountBriefs #Productivity #GTM #bestplacetowork #martechpulse

author.headline: Account Executive at Momentum | Enterprise Listening

resharedPost.text:
When I was VP Sales I'd spend countless hours watching demo recordings to coach my AEs.

It's necessary but incredibly annoying and time consuming because I'd have to watch 45 minute videos to find the 1 minute clip where the rep messed up.

When leading 5-10 AEs this is relatively manageable but when scaling upwards of 50+ AEs it becomes nearly impossible and we start relying on Managers and Directors. 

This is the stage of scale where the VP Sales starts to lose touch with the front lines. 

Not because they want to, but because the time commitment is no longer realistic. 

Fast forward to 2025 and Momentum.io has solved this problem.

Now your demo videos are automatically analyzed and the most important clips are edited down into a summary that internal stakeholders and leaders can quickly watch.

This is one of the most effective uses of AI in sales I've seen yet.

Anything that can enable a VP Sales or CRO to stay connected with the front lines and offer real coaching with limited time investment is a HUGE WIN.

It's called SmartClips and you should implement it ASAP.

author.headline: GTM @ Momentum

data.text:
Product marketing remains close to my heart so I LOOOOVE LAUNCH DAYS!

We‚Äôve added FIVE new amazing capabilities to Momentum.io that turn what happens in your conversations into even more intelligence for your team to act on:

1. Smart Clips ‚Äì Turn deal-winning call moments into instant, shareable video highlights using Prompts. Think TikTok meets your Your Sales Library. AI detects and clips the moments that matter (perfect pitches, objection handling, competitive mentions) and delivers them to Slack, Teams, or Momentum within minutes. 

2. Account Briefs ‚Äì Complete deal context without manual research. Every conversation starts with a clean, AI-compiled account view: all interactions, deal health, risks, and stakeholder maps. 

3. Coaching Agent Evolution ‚Äì Track and score every call against MEDDPICC, SPICED, Challenger, or your own process. See what‚Äôs working, where to improve, and feed it all back into Salesforce or our upgraded dashboard. 

4. Microsoft Support ‚Äì Momentum now lives in Teams & Outlook (!!). Summaries, briefs, and signals delivered right where Microsoft orgs work. Record and analyze Teams meetings, then deliver meeting context and follow-ups straight to your reps in Teams. 

6. Email Delivery ‚Äì Insights delivered to your inbox! (We know, not everyone loves Slack like we do...)
Summaries, briefs, and alerts sent automatically to your email so no critical intel gets lost. The right person, the right insight, at the right time.

The GTM execution gap isn‚Äôt a concept anymore. It‚Äôs a daily drag for revenue teams:

Hours lost scrubbing calls for the 3 minutes that matter.
Managers chasing updates across tools.
Reps prepping in a dozen tabs instead of focusing on the customer.

We're empowering GTM teams to run on reality, not lagging reports. Can't wait to have you try out the new stuff!

author.headline: VP of Sales Momentum.io | ex-Airtable | ex-Drift | ex-LogMeIn | ex-Navy SAR

data.text:
If you‚Äôre leading a revenue team today, your tech stack is likely filled with powerful tools: Outreach for outbound, Salesforce as your CRM, Gong for call intelligence, Clari for forecasting, and maybe a few others layered on top. 

Each tool solves a specific problem, but when they don‚Äôt talk to each other, they start creating new ones.

Instead of enabling your team, disconnected tools end up slowing them down. 

Insights get lost between systems. 
Reps spend hours on admin instead of selling. 
Leaders operate with incomplete context.

The solution isn‚Äôt ‚Äúone more tool.‚Äù 
It‚Äôs a layer of infrastructure that sits across your stack. 

One that listens across systems, connects the dots, and drives action. Not just surfacing insights, but pushing them to the right person, in the right system, at the right time.

Momentum.io doesn‚Äôt replace your stack, it makes it work like one. 

For the best revenue teams, that‚Äôs the real unlock.

author.headline: Co-founder/COO @ Momentum - AI GTM Data Orchestration

data.text:
50% AI and 50% human work will be the norm very soon.

However...

Ai is not a "Set It and Forget It" situation.

Kyle Norton mentioned this at the SaaStr AI Summit, and I agree 100% with it.

Here's how AI + human-in-the-loop actually works:

üéØ Lead Qualification & Research:

- Clay acts as your data aggregator by pulling from multiple sources and cross-verifying.
- Ai Agents for web scraping and search that helps create the building blocks for relevant outbound.
- Also, RB2B & Vector üëª identify anonymous website visitors, which we then enrich in Clay and automatically push into nurture sequences

üìß Nurturing & Messaging Optimization:

- Instantly.ai for cold email campaigns that book meetings AND gather market intelligence.
- Instantly's native AI reply agents handle initial responses (speed to lead is everything)
- A/B testing messaging at scale to understand what resonates with your ICP
- HeyReach.io is a non-negotiable for Linkedin outreach

‚öôÔ∏è CRM Hygiene & Admin Tasks:

- This is again where a tools like Clay or n8n help eliminate manual data entry and enrichments
- Momentum.io for automated CRM enrichment and real-time Slack notifications is phenomenal as well.
- AI handles call notes, follow-up reminders (Sybill is great for this)
- Why is this portion necessary? because lets face it, 50% of the day for most sellers is on non revenue generating activities.

This frees up sellers to:

‚úÖ Cold call into the highest-scoring accounts
‚úÖ Running qualified, high-value demos and discovery calls
‚úÖ Build relationships and trust with prospects
‚úÖ Negotiate deals and manage onboarding

‚òùüèºSend me a connection request if you would like a free copy of the exact playbook

author.headline: Helping businesses find Message-Market-Fit using GTM systems | Founder @ Warmleads.io

data.text:
There's a lot of talk about AI replacing sellers. But what‚Äôs actually happening inside enterprise sales orgs tells a different story.

In a recent conversation with Lori Richardson on Women Sales Pros, our COO Ashley Wilson breaks down the real role of AI in complex selling environments.

Her take?

AI isn‚Äôt here to replace human connection. It‚Äôs here to clear the path for it.
Reps aren't being replaced, they're being unburdened.

Busywork like note-taking, research, and pipeline updates? AI can handle that. But real selling: problem-solving, listening, and building trust is still a human advantage.

This is the shift we‚Äôre seeing across our customer base at Momentum. When sellers are free from low-value tasks, they spend more time in high-impact conversations. Pipeline moves faster. Forecasts get sharper. Coaching becomes proactive.

The conversation also touched on research that found an adoption gap where women are adopting AI tools at a rate 25% less than men.

Listen to the full podcast in the comments below.
We're #hiring a new Senior Frontend Engineer in Burnaby, British Columbia. Apply today or share this post with your network.

When real traction speaks, it shows up in the data.

Momentum is now ranked #267 out of millions of companies on Crunchbase.

With a Growth Score of 95 and Heat Score of 92, we‚Äôve officially joined the top 300.

The CB Rank reflects a company‚Äôs prominence across the global tech landscape, updated in real time and powered by actual performance.

This isn‚Äôt about hype. It‚Äôs about consistent execution and delivering real value to the teams we serve.

Others have raised $583M and hired 1,600+...

We‚Äôre not the challenger anymore.

The market has spoken: Momentum.io is the category.

VCs see it. Customers see it. Talent sees it.
And every sales call now starts with:

üìà Ramp, Demandbase, Zscaler, and 1Password are already onboard.
They know the future of GTM is AI-native, automated, and orchestrated.

So here's the play:
üéØ Transform unstructured customer interactions into structured data

üéØ Drive execution from first touch to renewal
üéØ And do it all from the place you already live: Slack or Teams.

We‚Äôre not chasing the market anymore.
We‚Äôre building it.

Onward. Faster. Smarter. Together.

author.headline: GTM @ Momentum | Watch Enthusiast, Motorcycles lover, Havanese dad

data.text:
Are you leveraging LLMs like ChatGPT to engage buyers?  Yesterday on our Stage 2 Capital Portfolio Roundtable, Jonathan M K., Eric Hann and Chris Long shared amazing advice and best practices to help our portcos leverage this quickly growing and potentially higher converting channel. (Order.co LLM leads converting 5x traditional SEO)

Key Takeaways: 
‚úîÔ∏è Search behavior is changing fast. Prospects are skipping Google and going straight to ChatGPT, Perplexity or Gemini. Because voice is becoming a common interface, prompts are shifting from short keywords to conversational questions ‚Äì people ‚Äúspeak‚Äù to the model the same way they talk on a sales call. It‚Äôs no longer about stuffing keywords; it‚Äôs about matching the natural language and intent behind a buyer‚Äôs question.

‚úîÔ∏èBrand mentions > backlinks. Google‚Äôs and OpenAI‚Äôs LLMs place huge weight on brand citations across the web, not just optimized pages. Studies show that companies only appear in AI‚Äëoverviews when they‚Äôre referenced in multiple reputable sources. It‚Äôs more like a PR campaign than classic SEO: get your brand (and product category) into articles, comparison lists and thought‚Äëleadership pieces so the model has evidence to recommend you.

‚úîÔ∏èTurn customer conversations into prompts. Momentum‚Äôs team mines sales‚Äëcall transcripts to hear real pains, then builds content around those phrases. Instead of optimizing for ‚ÄúCRM hygiene software,‚Äù they answer questions like ‚Äúwhat tools help with CRM hygiene?‚Äù and publish buyers‚Äëguides or ‚Äútop 10‚Äù lists that mirror those prompts.

‚úîÔ∏èStructure your content for AI. LLMs love dense, natural‚Äëlanguage FAQs because they deliver high cosine‚Äësimilarity to long‚Äëform prompts. Place FAQs on relevant product pages rather than hiding them on a single page. If you‚Äôre publishing transcripts or videos, summarise them and break them into topic‚Äëspecific clips ‚Äì the model struggles with long, noisy transcripts.

‚úîÔ∏èDistribution matters. Simply posting on your own blog isn‚Äôt enough. Repurpose every customer story into video clips, social posts and third‚Äëparty articles; apply for awards and encourage user reviews. Reddit emerged as the most influential external source; Google‚Äôs and OpenAI‚Äôs models often pull Reddit threads to get authentic, first‚Äëhand perspectives, so monitor and participate in relevant sub‚Äëreddits.

‚úîÔ∏èHow to start: Make a list of 10‚Äì25 core questions your ICP would ask. Use ChatGPT (with memory off) to see how it answers and where competitors show up. If you‚Äôre missing in action, create content to fill that gap and track the prompts over time. Buyer‚Äôs‚Äëguide style posts (e.g., ‚Äú9 best tools for‚Ä¶‚Äù) often get cited. 

Learn more in our LLM SEO guide linked in the comments.

article.title: Simplify Buying for Your Business | Order.co
article.subtitle: order.co

resharedPost.text:
Customer Success is under pressure and breaking. Not because the mission is wrong, but because the model hasn‚Äôt evolved.

CSMs are being asked to do more than ever:
-Drive renewals
--Own expansions
---Deliver onboarding
----Surface product insights
-----Be strategic advisors

All while trying to ‚Äúmaintain the human touch‚Äù at scale.

Here‚Äôs the problem: we‚Äôre layering more onto a role that was never designed to do it all.

But a shift is happening.

In our next AI Advantage webinar, we sit down with Dione Hedgpeth, former Chief Customer Officer at Sumo Logic, to talk about how top teams are rethinking the CSM role‚Äîand how AI is part of the answer.

We‚Äôll dive into:
1-Why the best orgs are splitting the CSM role into distinct motions
2-How AI is being used to detect risk, track adoption, and auto-generate insights
3-What skill sets matter most in an AI-enabled CS team
4-How companies like Momentum.io are scaling customer impact without scaling burnout

This is a clear-eyed look at what‚Äôs working, what‚Äôs broken, and what comes next.

If you lead or support CS, this is the conversation you‚Äôve been waiting for.

 July 22nd at 1 pm EST
Register on the event.

#CustomerSuccess #CSLeadership #AIinCS #CSMConundrum #AIAdvantage #GTMLeadership #AIEnablement

data.text: Calling my fellow Sales and CS leaders! I'll be speaking at AI Advantage: Solving the CSM Conundrum with AI! I'd love to see you at our chat on July 22.

author.headline: Chief Customer Officer, Board Member, Advisor

data.text:
Excited to share a piece I wrote for The AI Journal this week. 

The topic: what most AI tools are still missing, and why the next wave of adoption won‚Äôt come from copilots, but from¬†Agentic AI. 

Here‚Äôs the real gap.

Most revenue teams today don‚Äôt lack visibility.
They lack execution.

We‚Äôve overloaded reps with dashboards, summaries, and call transcripts and called that AI, but none of those tools actually take action.

The result?

-83 percent of customer data never makes it into your systems.
--45 percent of insights never reach the teams that could act on them.
---Up to 25 percent of annual revenue gets lost in the execution gap.

It‚Äôs not a tech stack problem.
It‚Äôs an operating system problem. 

Agentic AI flips the model.

It doesn‚Äôt just capture insights. It acts on them.
It doesn‚Äôt ask your team to do more. It does the thing for them.Update the CRM.

Route the risk signal.
Alert the AE.
Loop in the CSM.
Do it instantly. Inside the tools the team already uses. 
Without a new process to learn.

This shift is already underway.

Deloitte reports that 25 percent of companies will pilot agentic systems this year because leaders are done with passive AI that surfaces more work.

If you‚Äôre running a GTM motion right now, it‚Äôs worth asking:

Are you trying to scale execution with summaries and slides?
Or are you building the infrastructure that actually moves the needle?

Full article in comments. Curious what you think

author.headline: Co-Founder, CEO at Momentum | Enterprise Listening + Automation

data.text:
AI can add noise or it can deliver signal.

For Dealfront, the difference became clear in one week. üí•

"It ticks boxes not just for the individual contributors, but for the managers who have to manage those teams" said ‚Ä¢Stuart Moss‚Ä¢, Director of RevOps at DealFront.

When your GTM motion spans regions, roles, and languages, you can‚Äôt afford to fly blind. But that‚Äôs exactly what Dealfront was up against:
‚ùå Reps losing hours on manual notes and CRM entry.
‚ùå Zero visibility into what was actually happening in calls.
‚ùå No consistent data to drive enablement or strategy.

So what changed?

They piloted Momentum. Within days, the entire sales org was asking for it.

Here‚Äôs why:
‚úÖ Reps stopped taking notes and started focusing on customers. Momentum took care of summaries, clean data, and CRM updates.
 ‚úÖ Weekly Slack digests surfacing deal risks, competitor mentions, and buyer behavior to leaders
 ‚úÖ Marketing, Enablement, and Product all get relevant real-time alerts, routed to the right Slack channels.
 ‚úÖ No new tools. No change management.

‚ÄúWe just have such a stronger and better command of what's happening across our prospect and customer dialogues,‚Äù said Kevin McIntyre, CRO at Dealfront.

Now, instead of flying blind, they‚Äôre building strategy from the ground up on live customer data.

üìä Smarter decisions
üïí Faster execution
üìà Stronger alignment across every team

üëá Read Dealfront's story in the comments below.

Some people say ‚Äúcustomer-facing.‚Äù
 We say mission-critical.

At Momentum, our Solutions Consultants are the bridge between cutting-edge AI and the humans who use it every day to close deals, spot risks, and scale faster.

We‚Äôre hiring a new Solutions Consultant to join our CS team ‚Äî someone who‚Äôs technical enough to debug a workflow and curious enough to ask why it matters to the customer. Someone who doesn‚Äôt wait for a handoff but owns the relationship end-to-end.

This role is:
 ‚úÖ Remote from Buenos Aires, Argentina
 ‚úÖ Full-time with equity
 ‚úÖ High-impact, high-trust, and high-context

You‚Äôll love this role if:
- You‚Äôve worked with Salesforce Flows (or similar tools) and like getting your hands dirty
- You speak both ‚Äúcustomer‚Äù and ‚Äúengineer‚Äù fluently
- You‚Äôre the kind of person who remembers what the customer said three calls ago ‚Äî and builds what they need before they ask
- You‚Äôre excited to help shape the post-sale journey at a fast-growing Series A backed by FirstMark, and Stage 2 Capital.

We‚Äôre not a traditional CS team.
 We‚Äôre embedded partners driving outcomes, not just adoption.

Apply here ‚Üí https://lnkd.in/dnB2QTRS

#CustomerSuccess #SolutionsConsulting #SaaSCareers #Momentumio #TechJobsArgentina #AIforRevenue #WeAreHiring

When Kyle Norton talks sales strategy, we listen.

On the 20VC podcast with Harry Stebbings, Kyle (CRO at Owner.com) shared how his team uses Momentum.io to level up sales performance and coaching with precision.

üí¨ ‚ÄúWe use Momentum, which is our call recorder, and it's this AI tool that we can find the parts of calls that match our sales methodology the most closely‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs like all scripted to the word.‚Äù

Here‚Äôs why this matters: üöÄ High-performing sales orgs don‚Äôt just wing it.

They build repeatable systems that reduce decision fatigue and sharpen execution.

With Momentum, Owner‚Äôs team is able to:
‚úÖ Clip and catalog top call moments by methodology
‚úÖ Train and coach reps with real examples
‚úÖ Free up mental energy to focus on higher-order selling

‚ÄúScripting the basics enables you to offload that cognitive work‚Ä¶ You can spend your mental energy on higher-order things if you're executing a really repeatable process.‚Äù

This is what modern sales enablement looks like.

Thanks for the shoutout Kyle!

Most AI newsletters are written by people who‚Äôve never filled in a forecast.

They talk about what¬†might¬†happen. 
What AI¬†could¬†do.
What the future¬†might¬†look like.

That‚Äôs not what GTM teams need right now.

I remember a VP telling me once: 

Most teams already know their problems, too much admin, messy handoffs, no visibility, deals slipping without a signal. What they need are practical ways to fix them.

That‚Äôs why we built the Momentum.io AI Hub. 
Not as content. As a system.

Once a week, we send one email to over 10,000 GTM operators ‚Äî founders, CROs, RevOps leads, frontline managers ‚Äî the people who own the number and have no room for noise.

And here‚Äôs what they get:

- Prompt libraries based on real sales workflows. Think: generating a full MEDDICC summary from a call transcript, drafting deal updates in the rep‚Äôs voice, pulling buyer pain into renewal prep ‚Äî automatically.

- Automation templates that cut hours of admin every week. Trigger Slack updates from CRM changes. Auto-route call summaries to managers. Sync Salesforce fields with zero manual input.

- Field-tested use cases from top SaaS teams. We show how they‚Äôre using AI to coach reps, audit pipelines, spot risk early, and close faster ‚Äî not theory, just execution.

- Signals from the front lines. Insights from thousands of real sales conversations ‚Äî what buyers care about, where deals are stalling, and what top teams are doing about it.

If you're running a GTM motion right now, you won‚Äôt need to ‚Äúkeep up with AI.‚Äù 

You‚Äôll be the one building with it ‚Äî while others are still figuring out where to start.

Link in comments.

author.headline: Co-Founder, CEO at Momentum | Enterprise Listening + Automation

data.text:
Live events and relationships remain the most powerful tool for business. 

Another CRO Collective Roundtable event took place last night. 

This time it was a dinner hosted by The CRO Collective and Momentum.io. 

What we are building is simply unique. 

The CRO community is hungry for connection and collaboration.  

Some of the smartest people in one room. 

Learnings:

CROs understand the shift that‚Äôs taking place in the market right now. Outbound is dead on arrival and new technologies are creating entirely new ways to expand and scale.  

They realize that other CROs are their best resource for learning and risk taking.  

We‚Äôve also seen how CROs have unique superpowers and competencies that when combined can become a powerful resource for others.  

We are creating a superpower marketplace to accelerate knowledge and new best practices.   

If you are a CRO of a growth stage (post $25m in revenues) this is the community for you. 

Getting from $25m to $250m requires a very specific set of skills, tools and strategies.   This is the timeline where CRO‚Äôs are most vulnerable- and also have the greatest leverage.  

Thank you to everyone who brings their generosity and perspective to these gatherings.  

The next events planned for this year: 

July 24 - New York City
August 20th - Boston 
September 17th - San Francisco 
November 19th - Chicago 

If you are a CRO looking for the greatest live resource in the market, DM me ‚ÄòCRO Events‚Äô and I‚Äôll share more information.

Aviv Canaani  Desiree-Jessica Pely, PhD Jessica Robertson Jerry Dimos John E. Lepto IV üí™üèº Dan Hurwitz Steve Kost Suzanne Rabicoff Jody Rones Itai Karelic Danielle Moore Jarnot Matt Bruno Elio Narciso Saul Bello Andrew Travis

author.headline: Co-Founder, CEO at Momentum | Enterprise Listening + Automation

data.text:
Let‚Äôs talk about Deal Rooms done right.

In his Admins Connect session, Alejandro Oromy broke down how teams use Deal Rooms to drive alignment, reduce ramp time, and accelerate decision-making without flooding Slack.

Here‚Äôs what makes Momentum‚Äôs Deal Room automation a game-changer:

‚úÖ Triggered by Salesforce logic
Think of it like Salesforce Flow, but for Slack. You decide exactly when a room is created (e.g. deal hits $150K+ or moves to later stages).

‚úÖ No more manual wrangling
Reps can launch a Deal Room with a single click in Salesforce if you prefer a more ad hoc flow.

‚úÖ Invite the right people, every time
Pull from Opportunity owners, lookup fields, and related records to dynamically add the exact stakeholders you need.

‚úÖ Stay aligned through change
If ownership shifts, the new rep is auto-added to the existing room. No pings. No delays. Just seamless continuity.

üí° The result? Fewer missed handoffs. Faster onboarding. Real-time collaboration where your team already works.

author.headline: Co-founder/COO @ Momentum - AI GTM Data Orchestration

data.text:
What if you could instantly go back in time and clean up messy CRM data, surface lost insights, or retroactively tag customer conversations?

That‚Äôs exactly what Batch does.

In his Admins Connect session, Alejandro Oromy showed how teams use Autopilot Batch to:
üîπ Create new fields and instantly backfill old records
üîπ Clean up months of CRM data in just a few clicks
üîπ Analyze past conversations for objections, outcomes, or patterns
üîπ Turn historic calls into structured data without any manual effort

It‚Äôs like giving your RevOps team a time machine (but one that runs on clean Salesforce data and actual customer context).

Just define your criteria, run a Batch, and get real answers fast.

üöÄ Catch the demo in the video and see how Batch puts historical intelligence at your fingertips.

To fully harness AI, businesses need more than call transcripts and surface-level automation.

They need a data strategy and a framework that ensures no signal is left behind.

That‚Äôs where AEIOU comes in.

Internally, we use the AEIOU model at Momentum to ensure our platform captures, structures, and activates the data that actually drives revenue:

üü¢ A ‚Äì Aggregation brings the entire customer journey into view. We unify data across CRM, marketing automation, communications, and product usage to give AI full context.

 üü¢ E ‚Äì Extraction turns raw noise into patterns, sentiment, and structured signals that GTM teams can act on.

 üü¢ I ‚Äì Inputs go beyond calls. We capture the signals that matter across every channel: email, chat, meetings, even social.

 üü¢ O ‚Äì Outputs are where it all becomes real: real-time alerts, workflows, and recommendations that actually change how teams operate.

 üü¢ U ‚Äì Under the Hood, everything runs seamlessly. No added lift, no extra tabs. Just value, delivered fast.

The reality? Most GTM tools weren‚Äôt built with AEIOU in mind.

They leave gaps. Scattered data, inconsistent signals, and fragmented workflows.

To apply AI effectively, orgs need a foundation that supports:
 ‚úîÔ∏è Comprehensive data capture
 ‚úîÔ∏è Structured, high-quality inputs
 ‚úîÔ∏è Real-time handling and analysis
 ‚úîÔ∏è Automation that actually drives action

AEIOU gives us the lens. Now that the framework is clear, it‚Äôs time to apply it. Not in theory, but in practice.

If you‚Äôre a RevOps leader navigating data chaos, here's your chance to see how our Syncari Agentic MDM‚Ñ¢ can change the game.

Join our very own principal solutions engineer, Jack Smith on June 18th at 12:20 pm CT during RevOps Dimmo ü¶ñ Day to see how we help teams:

‚úîÔ∏è Eliminate CRM chaos
‚úîÔ∏è Operationalize AI safely
‚úîÔ∏è Maintain hierarchy and data integrity across every system

Don‚Äôt miss this demo alongside fellow innovators from Openprise, @TigerEye, Momentum.io, and Tango.

üìÖ Register: https://hubs.li/Q03synD80

#RevOps #MDM #AgenticMDM #AIReadyData #DimmoDay #SyncariLive

When Kyle Norton talks sales strategy, we listen.

On the 20VC podcast with Harry Stebbings, Kyle (CRO at Owner.com) shared how his team uses Momentum.io to level up sales performance and coaching with precision.

üí¨ ‚ÄúWe use Momentum, which is our call recorder, and it's this AI tool that we can find the parts of calls that match our sales methodology the most closely‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs like all scripted to the word.‚Äù

Here‚Äôs why this matters: üöÄ High-performing sales orgs don‚Äôt just wing it.

They build repeatable systems that reduce decision fatigue and sharpen execution.

With Momentum, Owner‚Äôs team is able to:
‚úÖ Clip and catalog top call moments by methodology
‚úÖ Train and coach reps with real examples
‚úÖ Free up mental energy to focus on higher-order selling

‚ÄúScripting the basics enables you to offload that cognitive work‚Ä¶ You can spend your mental energy on higher-order things if you're executing a really repeatable process.‚Äù

This is what modern sales enablement looks like.

Thanks for the shoutout Kyle!

What‚Äôs getting in the way of your reps actually selling?

According to Kyle Norton, CRO of Owner.com, it's not lack of talent or ambition. It‚Äôs the manual overhead.
üìâ CRM updates
üìâ Notes for the launch team
üìâ Admin tasks after every call

That friction adds up and it costs you revenue.

In a recent conversation with Jason M. Lemkin from SaaStr, Kyle shared how Momentum helps his team eliminate those bottlenecks and get back to selling:
‚úÖ Automatically enrich CRM after every call
‚úÖ Run custom prompts to update fields in Salesforce
‚úÖ Alert managers when expectations are misaligned before the deal closes
‚úÖ Eliminate post-call follow-up tasks for reps

And the impact?
 üîº 25‚Äì30% increase in revenue-generating activity time
 üîº No more worrying if the CRM is out of date
 üîº More deals closed, faster

"Momentum is the foundation for a bunch of our automation," Kyle said. "Like what is in the reps way of being on sales calls, following up, and generating revenue every single minute of the day."

üí° If you're looking to cut the noise, Momentum can help you get there.
